dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: React is a JavaScript library created by Facebook for building user interfaces, focusing on speed, simplicity, and scalability.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I have never heard of that before

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: React is a JavaScript library created by Facebook to build user interfaces, and it's great for making dynamic web apps that can update without needing to reload the page.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Can you explain it in layman's terms a little better?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: React is like a tool for building parts of a website that can change without needing the whole page to reload, making sites faster and more interactive.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Can you give me any examples?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: For example, Facebook uses React to make its newsfeed update smoothly without reloading the whole page.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh that's cool! Who else uses it?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Instagram also uses React to make their site run smoothly, and it's popular among many big companies for building interactive web applications.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: What about Reddit? Do they use it?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm not sure if Reddit uses React specifically, but many big sites do use it for their interfaces.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh okay.. can I use it for a website I want to make?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Absolutely! React is open-source, so you can definitely use it to build your own website and make it fast and interactive.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Is it free for me to use? Where do I get started with it?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yes, React is free to use, and you can get started by checking out the official React documentation online.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: What are the pros and cons of it?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: React is great because it's fast and scalable, but it can be tricky to learn at first, especially if you're new to JavaScript.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I don't know anything about JavaScript tbh

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: No worries! React is beginner-friendly once you get the hang of JavaScript basics, and there are lots of resources to help you learn.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: What resources can I use?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You can start with online tutorials like freeCodeCamp, MDN Web Docs, or React's official documentation.
